channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for VA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for VA

item.title: Report X-2024071321
item.description:
Report X-2024071321

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-22T18:15:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-07-16
  • City: CHANTILLY
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Two out of four plastic jugs of Rapicide high level disinfectant had loose caps and began leaking. The other two jugs seem to be fine. Shipment became soiled due to the leaks.

item.title: Report X-2024071302
item.description:
Report X-2024071302

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-22T18:15:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-29
  • City: HAMPTON
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hazmat was found by a Ops Supervisor. Hazmat was placed in the Hazmat Cage under hood with vent turned on. Hazmat has no inner packing which cause the damage from handling the hazmat. The caps on the bottles became loose which caused the minor leakage.

item.title: Report E-2024070344
item.description:
Report E-2024070344

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-18T15:13:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-06-13
  • City: CHESTER
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that 1-cup of Forever Seal HP3502 released onto the dock and trailer floor, out of a 1-gallon metal pail. The pail was punctured by a forklift. ERTS reviewed the SDS and the caller declined assistance and cleaned the spill with the available PPE on site.

item.title: Report I-2024060040
item.description:
Report I-2024060040

Identified by scraper @ 2024-07-18T15:13:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-28
  • City: CLOVERDALE
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHEASTERN FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During the unloading phase of trailer, employee was attempting to unload a pallet of freight with a forklift, the forklift blades were protruding past the pallet and punctured a drum in front of the pallet. Contact was made at the bottom side of the drum putting a 4.0 inch long puncture in the drum. Drum was then placed in a position to where the material would not leak further. All spillage of material was confined to immediate area for cleanup.
